result.execSummary:
The defendant David D Ervins Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. David D Ervins Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • David D Ervins Jr was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Incident], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: $343 paid in full by bond.  $200 DNA surcharge remitted.
Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with DR without prior written approval of agent. Not be in the 400 block of South Bird St Sun Prairie WI.
Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals related to prioritized need areas identified.  Defendant advised of requirement to provide DNA sample.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Court reporter: Denise Severson.  Judgment of conviction prepared.

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Dorothea Claire Watson.  Cara J Throckmorton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David D Ervins in court with attorney Dorothea Claire Watson. Prosecuting Atty Cara J Throckmorton appeared for State of Wisconsin.Defn's motion to set bail.  Atty Watson makes argument for ct to set bail.  ADA Throckmorton agrees that ct. has authority to set bail but opposes it. Atty Watson makes argument for ct. to set signature bond.  ADA Throckmorton makes argument for revocation of bail. Ct. denies defense motion to set bail.  Ct. rules that revocation of bail is appropriate.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 28, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Motion hearing on June 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant's

Attorney Dorothea Claire Watson in court.  Defendant not in court, in custody.  Cara J Throckmorton appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Dorothea Claire Watson in court for Defendant David D Ervins. Prosecuting Atty Cara J Throckmorton appeared for State of Wisconsin. Atty Watson requests that sentencing after revocation happens after trial on 16CF191. Ct will set this hearing over until after trial in 16CF191.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 05-04-2016 02:15 pm

allowing Atty Cuevas to Withdraw

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Luis C Cuevas.  Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant David D Ervins in court. Prosecuting Atty Andrea Beth Raymond appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Cuevas indicates that defendant wants Atty Cuevas to withdraw.  Defendant requests the court to appoint a new attorney. Ct has collequy with defendant about right to attorney. Ct grants motion for Atty Cuevas to withdraw and instructs Atty Cuevas to transfer case to new attorney.  Bail continues.
